description: Moved the section starting and ending Luke's Wall from 7th position to 12th position, based on what Tony does in every live performance I could see him doing it in (5 or 6 of them, both early and late). Also changed the trill part of the solo to a bend on the 9th fret rather than moving up to the 11th, as that's what he did early in his career and is likely more accurate to the album version (check California Jam and live in Paris 1970 if you're curious). It is worth nothing that, as previously mentioned, later on, he slides up to 11 rather than bending 9 up to that Bb (in live from The End, for example)
title: War Pigs

description:
Reverted to my previous version
NOTE TO PEOPLE WHO MAY BE CHANGING THINGS:
As far as I know, the fingerings are what Tony Iommi plays live, they're not all optimal, but that's how he plays the song, and that's the way I believe it should be tabbed. The only part of the song I've noticed he plays differently is the 11 9 7 9 7 9 part of the solos, where he sometimes bends 9 up to 11, sometimes does it all HO/POs as it's tabbed, or sometimes slides up to 11 and then back down to 9.
title: War Pigs

description:
The same sound, different fingerings for optimal speed and comfort.

title: War Pigs

description:

description:
-Revised intro to better fit how Tony plays live.
look closely at this video from Ozzfest 2005: https://youtu.be/9ssDXiMLX9o
title: War Pigs

description:
- Changes to the fills in the main sections of the song (the 'buh-da' part)
- Minor change to the rhythm for the solo part of Luke's Wall
- Changed where the B5 chord is played on measure 125 and 129. The fact that you can hear Iommi's fingers moving on the strings makes me think the root is on the 2nd fret of the A string and not the 7th fret of the E string.
title: War Pigs

description: It is extremely frustrating to have people make the tab worse. Please do not.
title: War Pigs

description: Added palm mutes on the notes on the open E string in the first and second verses.
